ModuleDescription: A study of the work of a major figure in philosophy. The philosopher studied may be from the Asian or Western tradition, from any period up to the present day. The philosopher selected may be someone important who has not been given much coverage in other courses.
Prerequisite:
Cohort 2011 and before:
Completed 80 MCs, including 28 MCs in PH or 28 MCs in EU/LA
(French/German)/recognised modules, with a minimum CAP of
3.50 or be on the Honours track. Cohort 2012-2014:
Completed 80MCs, including 28 MCs in PH or 28 MCs in EU/LA
(French/German)/recognised modules, with a minimum CAP of
3.20 or be on the Honours track. Cohort 2015 onwards:
Completed 80MCs, including 28 MCs in PH or 28 MCs in EU/LA
(French/German/Spanish)/recognised modules, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track.
